publicwhip.spmotion: *S3M-3596 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Leith Docks to Retain Name—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by Forth Ports to drop its plans to rebrand part of the waterfront development at Leith Docks as Edinburgh Harbour; recognises the historical significance of the Port of Leith and the strong and distinct identity of the area, and welcomes the decision of Forth Ports to listen to the opinion of the thousands of Leith residents who ran a successful campaign against the name change.
S3M-3596 Leith Docks to Retain Name (lodged on 3 March 2009) Jamie Hepburn*, Bob Doris*, Robin Harper*, Cathy Peattie*, Christina McKelvie*, Rob Gibson*, Christine Grahame*, Bill Kidd*
S3M-3596 Leith Docks to Retain Name (lodged on 3 March 2009) Malcolm Chisholm*, Alasdair Allan*

S3M-3596 Shirley-Anne Somerville: Leith Docks to Retain Name—That the Parliament welcomes the decision by Forth Ports to drop its plans to rebrand part of the waterfront development at Leith Docks as Edinburgh Harbour; recognises the historical significance of the Port of Leith and the strong and distinct identity of the area, and welcomes the decision of Forth Ports to listen to the opinion of the thousands of Leith residents who ran a successful campaign against the name change. Supported by: Jamie Hepburn, Bob Doris, Robin Harper, Cathy Peattie, Christina McKelvie, Rob Gibson, Christine Grahame, Bill Kidd, Malcolm Chisholm, Alasdair Allan, Michael Matheson*
S3M-3596 Leith Docks to Retain Name (lodged on 3 March 2009) Angela Constance*
